You call for reports, call teammates feeders, and you generally argue throughout game 1. Most people don't use chat this frequently, but you used almost all of game 1 to belittle teammates.

Game 2: You call for reports and call bot and Viktor a inters.

Game 3: You insult top and adc, in addition to constantly requesting that your team ff.

Additionally, it only takes 1 report to trigger a review of one's game; additional reports do not cause an increase in likelihood of being punished, so lines like:

>Scottez: 9x vik
Scottez: 9x malph thanks

Having skimmed it, I'd say some of the contributing factors are spamming (specifically game 1, that's a *lot* of lines of chat to be typing out), saying things like "gg" (specifically in the context of referring to a team mates failures/mistakes) is generally considered toxic, repeatedly "demanding" a forfeit (such as in game 3) could have also contributed, consistently placing blame on team mates (regardless of whether it's true) in a negative manner would likely also contribute.

As a general rule of thumb, swearing *in and of itself* isn't punishable (after all, why bother having an optional language filter if it is), but things like targeted swearing is punishable (didn't notice any "targeted swearing/profanity", but as I said I just skimmed it).

PS: In all likelihood, there'll probably be certain boards users who'll post responses going on about things like "rito ban for saying anything". I'd highly recommend just ignoring them, they have next to no idea what they're talking about.

So I've gone over the logs more thoroughly. The stuff I mentioned before are obviously contributing factors, unnecessarily constant chat use (if game 1 was a ~30 minute game, it seems like you *might* have been typing for about half of it), the use of "gg" to point out a bad situation and the faults of the team, "demanding" the forfeit in game 3, the consistent use of blame on team mates in a negative manner.

Beyond that, it seems like a lot of the things you said carried a passive-aggressive connotation, which is an attitude that generally just makes a bad situation worse. Constantly calling for reports on specific players doesn't help either. Generally it's best just to ask once and leave it at that (either the other players will or wont report, but "demanding" it of them makes them less likely to do so). Also, it's possible the use of the term "b!tch" in game 2 may have contributed (generally a term used as a directed insult, not often used in an indirect manner).

If I had any advice for you, I'd recommend you try to focus on what *you* are doing in games. If someone else is doing the wrong thing, just try to play out the game without stooping so you can report them in the post-game lobby. Mute people if you feel you need to, you could even move the chat box off the side of the screen to keep it out of view. I know it can be difficult to deal with people who are like that, but ultimately it is better that you focus on you and keep a cool head, at least until you can take a break, so you don't get dragged down with them.

With that in mind, it might be a good idea to take a break from LoL (even online games in general) and focus on gaining control over how you react to these kinds of situations. Even if the ban isn't revoked (which doesn't seem likely, as I stated earlier) you have the option of starting anew with a fresh account, but that wont help the situation any if you're still behaving in this kind of manner, so it's better you take the time if you need it.

While re-reading this comment, especially the 3rd paragraph, i don't think you realize that the more you report people the lower your report is regarded in riots system, i think i only got 4 instant feedback reports that someone was punished for over about 2500 games of league, which nearly every single game, i sent at least one report (just an avg). so about 4 or 5 instant feedback reports in 2500 games seems like either the report system isn't working, or constantly reporting bad behavior, weather it be in game behavior or chat behavior doesn't work because of that stupid system that makes ur reports worth less the more you do it. Point is, people are this negative in the game ALL the time, its not rare, it is literally every 1/3 games at least, reporting does nothing, especially when people like me, who didn't send one significant insult get banned and others that literally say stuff like "f* your mom" and "you suck so much shit" don't even get a look. SO if i record every single game from now on, and send every negative piece of behavior to riot, will all of those guys get a chat restrict or suspension? will they get punished at all? Or is riot going to just pick on the few who actually made a significant mistake in the past (like i did with my first suspension last year) and leave them gaping for something so trivial?

The thing to keep in mind with the IFS is that it doesn't notify *everyone* who submits a valid report. Last I heard, it only notifies those who were the *most recent* reports prior to punishment (such as being in the game that triggers the punishment), so not receiving the notifications doesn't necessarily mean they were ignored, invalid or that the player wasn't punished, it just means that, if something did happen, you, personally, didn't receive the notification.

Generally, Riot wants people to report *any* behaviour they believe shouldn't exist within the game, it's those kinds of report that help shape what is and isn't acceptable in-game. As I understand it, the validity of reports is generally considered on a case-by-case basis, rather than based on the reporter's history with valid reports (though I imagine that players with an "extreme" amount of invalid reports would be treated as unreliable). If that's not the case, it doesn't really make sense for people to be reporting something they're not sure of, after all.
